activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

records.addlTxt:
9:04 AM Defendant Mario T Wilson in court.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel yet.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

2:06 PM Defendant Mario T Wilson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Mario T Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
